extendedIngredients.name: flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup Gluten-Free or Regular Flour+

extendedIngredients.name: fresh mint leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons fresh finely chopped Mint leaves

extendedIngredients.name: ground nutmeg
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon ground Nutmeg (preferably freshly grated)

extendedIngredients.name: half & half
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 wide-mouth Half Pint Mason jars (or Kerr)

extendedIngredients.name: rolled oats
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup Whole Rolled Oats, (not instant)+

recipes.title: Blueberry Mint Crumble in Jars
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.Spray the insides and rim of the jars and place them on a baking sheet.In a medium bowl, combine all of the ingredients for the filling. Spoon the filling into the jars, using the back of a mixing spoon to press blueberries down if needed to allow about ½ inch for the topping.  Note: the filling will compress when cooking.In a separate bowl, combine all of the ingredients for the topping. Spoon the topping evenly across the four jars, distributing across to the top of the filling to cover it.  Place baking sheet with jars in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until the filling is bubbly and the tops are lightly golden in color.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.Spray the insides and rim of the jars and place them on a baking sheet.In a medium bowl, combine all of the ingredients for the filling. Spoon the filling into the jars, using the back of a mixing spoon to press blueberries down if needed to allow about ½ inch for the topping.  Note: the filling will compress when cooking.In a separate bowl, combine all of the ingredients for the topping. Spoon the topping evenly across the four jars, distributing across to the top of the filling to cover it.
Place baking sheet with jars in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until the filling is bubbly and the tops are lightly golden in color.
